thread.title: Neymar to stand trial on corruption charges over irregularities in move from Santos to Barcelona in 2013
thread.title_full: Neymar to stand trial on corruption charges over irregularities in move from Santos to Barcelona in 2013 - Mirror Online

author: mirror.co.uk
title: Neymar to stand trial on corruption charges over irregularities in move from Santos to Barcelona in 2013
text:
Neymar to stand trial on corruption charges over irregularities in move from Santos to Barcelona in 2013 Barcelona and Santos will also stand trial over claims part of the transfer fee was concealed Share By Martin Domin 15:47, 20 FEB 2017 Updated 15:57, 20 FEB 2017 Sport Neymar will stand trial on corruption charges (Photo: REUTERS) Share Get football Neymar has lost his final appeal against corruption charges and will stand trial.
The charges relate to his move from Santos to Barcelona four years ago and could see him jailed for two years.
The Brazil international, whose father will also stand trial, is more likely to be fined up to $10million (£8m), however.
Both Santos and Barcelona lost their own appeals and will also stand trial with prosecutors seeking a fine of $9m (£7.2m) from the Spanish side and $7m (£5.6m) from the player's former club.
Neymar played in Barcelona's win over Leganes on Sunday (Photo: REUTERS) Read More Neymar facing two-year prison sentence as Spanish authorities probe transfer to Barcelona Brazilian investment group DIS filed a complaint last year after claims they were due 40 per cent of the 24-year-old's transfer rights, which could be worth up to £30m.
DIS have complained that due to the transfer fee being concealed, the eventual sum they received for their stake in the player was far less than it should have been.
